title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
A U.S. plan to force the sale of TikTok's American operations has been shelved indefinitely as Biden undertakes a review of his predecessor's efforts to address potential security risks from Chinese tech firms.

---

An executive at Tencent has been held by Chinese authorities, part of a probe into a corruption case involving one of China's former top law-enforcement officials.

---

Large U.S. lenders saw their loan books shrink in 2020 for the first time in more than a decade, according to an analysis of Fed data.

---

Uber posted a narrower annual loss on the back of food delivery and cost cutting, even as the pandemic crushed its ride-hailing operations.

---

GM reported strong quarterly earnings and gave a bright profit outlook despite an expected hit from a global chip shortage.

---

Toyota boosted its profit projections and said it would launch three new electric-car models in the U.S. this year.

---

The Dow rose 0.2% to a record, while the Nasdaq and S&P 500 lost 0.25% and 0.03%, respectively.

---

Fidelity Investments sold nearly all of its positions in GameStop last month, just as shares of the videogame retailer were surging.

---

Coca-Cola posted weaker quarterly profit and revenue and disclosed a potential $12 billion tax liability.

---

United said it plans to buy up to 200 flying taxis from an electric aircraft startup.
